article_node.title: Strong winds and waves batter Nantucket, Marthaâ€™s Vineyard as Hurricane Erin moves out to sea
article_node.summary: Hurricane Erin, a massive Category 2 storm, has caused significant waves and rip currents along the East Coast, leading to beach closures from North Carolina to New England. The Outer Banks experienced flooding and damage, but widespread destruction was limited as the storm moved offshore. Despite the dangerous conditions, some surfers took to the waves, while officials urged caution and issued warnings for potential coastal flooding.
